label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The actress Mademoiselle Leclerc dressed in a ballet costume, seen frontally, her head turned to the left. Framing line and stripe.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and brown ink, brush and brown, pink, and gray watercolor on white paper

label: Description
value: A two-master is shown in the first plane. Rather a strong wind. A lighthouse is at the cape. The signature L G Haccon f is written upon a sail. Framing line.

label: Description
value: One of the ships lies near the coast in the first plane. A rowing boat with a s tanding man in it is beside it. A big ship flying the Dutch flag is shown in the middle plane. Other ships are in the right background.
A Ballet Dancer, Mademoiselle Marie Allard

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The actress Marie Allard (1742-1802), dressed in a Polonaise, is seen frontally, about to execute a pas de deux.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown, pink, and gray wash over graphite on white laid paper

label: Description
value: Illustration, interior with three figures. Man holding whip threatens a Black figure, standing right. Woman at left, holding a tankard, placers her hand on shoulder of man with whip.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and watercolor on paper
Illustration, The Laughable Adventures of a Sleepy Charley

label: Description
value: Outdoor scene, at night. A man in a sedan chair, being carried by two others toward left.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper
Decorative Cartouche with a Lagoon Capricco

label: Description
value: A view of a waterway with a ruined structure on a small promentory and surrounded by various figures, enclosed in a central escutcheon with assymetrical side panels.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor over black chalk on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Unknown English (?) collection (sale, lot 22, according to indications on verso of drawing); George Guy, Fourth Earl of Warwick (Lugt 2600) (sale London, Christie's, 17 July 1896, lot no. 164), as Francesco Guardi Raimundo De Madrazo Miss Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: With his right hand, a boy supports a basket-tray resting on a boulder base; with his outstretched left hand he offers a biscuit (or bar of soap?).  On the basket-tray are biscuits (cakes of soap?) and bottles.  A tree trunk is in the right background.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, white chalk on greenish-blue-gray paper

label: Provenance
value: Robert W. Weir (Lugt 2559); Erskine Hewitt (acquired by bequest).

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. The male figure of Chronos, Time, shown in profile with wings and a long beard at left, lowers the baby Cupid onto a rock. The goddess Venus sits at the rock's summit, facing forward, sandals on her feet and jewelry at her neck, her face turned towards Chronos and the baby. She sits upon a pile of drapery. Behind her, another nude female figure kneels. Behind the two women are two cupids at left, one carrying a horn, and a soldier with decorated shield at right. In the foreground, at right, a snake curls around the edge of a broken wagon axel, a white bird prepares to alight on the ground below the snake. In the background at right, a rocky landscape with architectural ruins. The figure of a vulture on a pedestal at right, caryatid figure at right edge.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, over black chalk on brown laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Raimundo di Madrazo; Sarah Cooper Hewitt.
Portrait of the Emperor Charles V

label: Description
value: Portrait of a beared man in profile.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: 1938: bequested to Museum by Erskine Hewitt
Three Putti: Design for a Grisaille Painting

label: Description
value: Two putti, of whom one holds a fool's staff, dance to the music of a flute played by a third putto. The scene is set against an architectural background.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and wash on heavy blue paper

label: Description
value:
A seated shepherdess, seen from the right back, plays on a pipe to a young shepherd, seen frontally, lying on the ground on his stomach, crook in his right hand. Inscribed, lower right: "Boucher."

On the reverse is a sticker inscribed "Estate of Robert W. Weir, No.1920."

label: Physical description
value: Red and black chalks on brownish paper, water-marked with a winged lion-like beast.

label: Description
value: A woven portrait of the Comtesse de Provence is embroidered to the fabric that forms the frame. The frame is a wreath of multicolor flowers with a bow at the top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 4 & 1 satin with discontinuous supplementary wefts bound on the front in plain weave by a supplementary warp

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 106 x 76.5 cm (41 3/4 x 30 1/8 in.)

label: Description
value: A woven portrait of the Comte de Provence is embroidered to the fabric that forms the frame. The frame is a woven wreath of multicolor flowers with a bow at the top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 4 & 1 satin with discontinuous supplementary wefts bound on the front in plain weave by a supplementary warp
Zouaves in the Camp of St. Maur

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Zouave troops encamped at St. Maur, lying around in a circle, one male figure at the center. In the background at left, a group of tourists observing them, the women carrying parasols and the men wearing high silk hats.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and blue, brown, and gray wash, graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Cylindrical, rounded at bottom and having a cylindrical foot; two outcurving foliate handles on sides. Decorated with brown simulation of wood graining, with reserve rectangular panel decorated in black with simulation of landscape print.

label: Description
value: Cover of curled-up cat with the head in high relief, decorated with black and yellow enamel markings.  Ground glaze of small crackle orange-yellow.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (a): 2.5 x 6 cm (1 x 2 3/8 in.) H x diam. (b): 2.7 x 6.1 cm (1 1/16 x 2 3/8 in.)
Title page, plate 1 from "Nouvelle Suitte de Cahiers chinois"

label: Description
value: A title page: two branches extend vertically at right and left, between which is strung a sheet which reads: 'Nouvelle Suitte de Cahiers chinois a l'usage des déssinateurs et des Peintres. Inventés ed déssinés Par Jean Pillement. Gravés par Anné allen." Below, a staircase and imaginative botanicals rendered in various colors, which bleed into one another within the etched lines.

label: Physical description
value: Etching a la poupée and colored inks on paper

label: Description
value: Ovoid, with high looped handles and small cylindrical neck. On square plinth (b) with relief palmette decoration, and ogee foot (d) with leaf-molded edge. Flat cylindrical cover (c) with relief palmette and guilloche decoration, and vase finial.

label: Description
value: Flattened spherical shape with wide, looped handle and conical spout. The high domed cover had knob composed of a draped female figure. Lower portion of pot is decorated with rays in low relief, sides with high relief groups of Bacchanalian putti and handle with leaf ornament. Thin shaped collar about mouth. Leaf and chevron reliefs on cover. Inside glazed.

label: Description
value: Cylindrical with entasis; molded projecting base and collar. Low domed cover with knob. Sides decorated in relief with two identical scenes of landscape and two greyhounds; band of ivy about cover, and lotus rosette on knob, in relief.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Elliptical in plan, with large lip and strap handle. Relief decoration: guilloche wit fleuron about shoulder, fluting at base, mourning woman and dog at eat side. Glazed on inside. Vertical mold marks on each end.

label: Description
value: Semi ovoid, with simple molded foot, cavetto shoulder. Outward curving spout and two pierced tables for handle; flat domed cover with “window” knob. Low relief decoration of vertical chevron bands and horizontal ribbing; leaf ornament on spout and on handle attachments; beading on collar about mouth. Simple radiating chevron on cover. Flat brass handle soldered with hooks.

label: Dimensions
value: 15.5 x 22 cm (6 1/8 x 8 11/16 in.) with handle down: 15.5 x 17.5 cm (6 1/8 x 6 7/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; Erskine Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Cylindrical, high domed lid with finial in the form of a draped female figure; basket-weave texture sides and lid.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (a, b: overall): 14.9 x 9.2 cm (5 7/8 x 3 5/8 in.) H x diam. (a: bowl): 7.8 x 9.1 cm (3 1/16 x 3 9/16 in.) H x diam. (b: lid): 7.1 x 9.2 cm (2 13/16 x 3 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Tall, slightly swelling body, long loop handle, short spout; high domed lid with finial in the form of a draped female figure.  Sides of body (lower portion) and lid with basket-weave texture; wide band top section of body plain.

label: Provenance
value: Collection of Eleanor G. Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Circular, on raised foot, sides have basket-weave texture, inside smooth.

label: Description
value: Slightly swelling form, short spout, long loop handle; sides with basket-weave texture.

label: Physical description
value: Moulded and thrown unglazed stoneware (Black Basalt)

label: Description
value: Semi ovoid, with simple molded foot, cavetto shoulder. Outward curving lip and flattened strap handle. Silver band about base of foot, silver vine about shoulder, silver dotting on handle and silver line about opening edge.

label: Physical description
value: Moulded and thrown unglazed stoneware (Black Basalt), encaustic silver decoration

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; Erskine Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Molded foot, ribbed sides, plain band about top with blueish silver vine. Cover ribbed in radiating pattern, with lion knob. Silver band about edge of cover and bottom of foot.

label: Physical description
value: Moulded and thrown unglazed stoneware (Black Basalt)

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; Erskine Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Molded with reeding and decorated with vine motif.

label: Physical description
value: Moulded and thrown unglazed stoneware (Black Basalt)

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; Erskine Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Vase in lekythos shape. Flat handle, beading about neck, small foot. Floral decoration in Chinese style of chrysanthemums and leaves, with smaller flowers in colors. Dull red bands on edges of handle and about neck and mouth.

label: Physical description
value: stoneware (Black Basalt), enameled and painted decoration

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt; Erskine Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Four-sided, serpentine sides, front longer than back; shaped edges, scrolled feet.  Cover set on angle, with five cups for bulbs and two piercings.  Relief panels in front and two sides, with putti bearing garland, against orange field; borders filled with floral forms in pink and white, inside glazed.

label: Description
value: Silversmith’s shape: oblong with four bowed panels alternating with four rectangular panels containing niches; long ogee spout, rectangular flat handle. Oblong domed cover with strap handle, sliding in grooves in top of pot. Relief decoration in polychrome showing classical figures in the bow panels; vines in niches; lotus and anthemion band about cavetto shoulder, leaves on handle, spout and cover.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; Erskine Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value:
flat bottom; slightly cavetto marly decorated with concentric bands of wreath enclosing a peacock on cylindrical vessel, flanked by armorial devices - caption below, in Gothic letters: Les Repas de Chevalerie - pendant to 1938-57-319, -320, to -324, -326, to -330 - compare with: 1936-13-14.
porcelain decorated in yellow, green, red and brown with gilding

label: Provenance
value: formerly in the collection of Rev. Alfred Duane Pell, [this information by way of George B. McClellan, 14, December, 1938].

label: Description
value: Decorated in yellow, green, red and brown, with gilding. Flat bottom: slightly cavetto marly decorated with concentric bands of yellow and gold, edged with serpentine vine with berries. In bottom, gold laurel wreath enclosing a trophy composed of confections; caption below, in Gothic letters: "Les Patisseries".

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Provenance
value: Erskine Hewitt [1]; 1938: bequested to Museum           [1] Previous owners include Reverend Alfred Duane Pell and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Description
value: Curved sides, cylindrical foot, shell handle. Chinoiserie decoration of shore and fishermen, one in boat. Border of lotus flowers in rectangles, and scrolls. Pierced with round holes in two rows, at right angles.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; Erskine Hewitt; 1938: acquired by Museum
Soup Tureen with the Arms of the Scholten-Hogenberg Family

label: Description
value: A tureen, lid and stand decorated in gilt with red details. Depicted on the set are small flowers and an emblem with a chicken, lobster, and other items.

value: H x W x D (a: tureen, b: cover): 18.6 x 36 x 18.3 cm (7 5/16 x 14 3/16 x 7 3/16 in.) H x W x D (c: stand): 3.2 x 36.3 x 21.2 cm (1 1/4 x 14 5/16 x 8 3/8 in.)

value: A tureen, lid and stand decorated in gilt with red details. Depicted on the set are small flowers and an emblem with a chicken, lobster, and other items.

label: Description
value: Potpourri vase molded with relief decoration around piercings on shoulder and lid. Gilded bands at base, neck and lid. Handles with mascarpone crowned with water reeds. Painted courtship scenes. Knob in the form of a rose.
